body:
<!-- If you need help or think you have found a bug, please help us with your issue by entering the following information (otherwise you can delete this text): -->

When checking for the version of `helm` installed, the `get` script uses the `helm` binary on `PATH`. It should use the `helm` binary found in `HELM_INSTALL_DIR` instead

```
$ helm version
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.14.3", GitCommit:"0e7f3b6637f7af8fcfddb3d2941fcc7cbebb0085", GitTreeState:"clean"}

$ export HELM_INSTALL_DIR=/Users/cipriano/bin

$ $HELM_INSTALL_DIR/helm version
Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.12.3", GitCommit:"eecf22f77df5f65c823aacd2dbd30ae6c65f186e", GitTreeState:"clean"}

$ ./get --version v2.14.3
Helm v2.14.3 is already v2.14.3
```

This is a bit of an edge case, where a user has `helm` installed and available on their `PATH`, but wants to install another version to a specific `HELM_INSTALL_DIR`. Currently it will take no action if the desired specified version to be installed is the same as the version available in `PATH`, regardless of what version is found at `HELM_INSTALL_DIR`. What it should do is check the version of `helm` using the binary located at `HELM_INSTALL_DIR` and update the version there if appropriate.
title: get script version check does not respect HELM_INSTALL_DIR
